bibl.title: Notes on Oxyrhynchus Papyri III.
bibl.note: Suite de: ZPE 129 (2000) pp. 183-184. - P. Iand. III, 40: Onomastics and provenance. - P. Iand. III, 50: An axle 'bought in the fields'. - P. Köln III, 159: A hidden fraction. - P. Mich. XV, 743: Ghost minus-carats. - P. Mich. XV, 748: Date, and a crux. - P. Oxy. I, 204 descr. (= S.B. XXII, 15365), XVI, 2045 & 2057: Militiamen in the service of the 'glorious house'. - P. Oxy. VI, 993: An evasive 'steward', a small dossier, and a date. - P. Oxy. XVI, 1980: Guild 'officials'. - P. Oxy. XVIII, 2197 & P.U.G. II, 70: A ghost name. - P. Oxy. XIX, 2244, fr. 1: paidãria and meizÒteroi. - P. Oxy. XXII, 2350; iii: Some textual gains. - P. Oxy. XXXVI, 2799: Some details. - P. Oxy. XLVII, 4607: Two well-known Oxyrhynchites. - [P. Berol. Inv. 21754 recto =] S.B. XXIV, 15960: Provenance. <paidaria, meizoteroi>
